headline: Salesforce Stock Jumps on Earnings Beat
summary: Salesforce  reported better-than-expected first-quarter earnings on Wednesday afternoon.  Salesforce also gave strong guidance for the second quarter, above Wall Street expectations, and raised its fiscal 2026 outlook.  On Wednesday, Salesforce announced its intent to buy  Informatica  a company that provides data management and integration services, which will support Salesforce’s AI play, Agentforce.

headline: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) Beats Q1 Sales Targets, Stock Soars
summary: Customer relationship management software maker Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.6% year on year to $9.83 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $10.14 billion at the midpoint, 1.2% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.58 per share was 1.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) Beats Q1 Sales Targets, Stock Soars
raw.summary: Customer relationship management software maker Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) reported Q1 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.6% year on year to $9.83 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $10.14 billion at the midpoint, 1.2% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.58 per share was 1.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Salesforce stock gets lift on Q1 beat, full-year outlook
summary: Releasing quarterly results after Wednesday's closing bell, Salesforce (CRM) posted first quarter revenue of $9.83 billion (vs. estimates of $9.75 billion) and adjusted earnings of $2.58 per share (vs. estimates of $2.44 per share). Salesforce shares are getting a lift in extended hours trading on this positive earnings news. Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton dive deeper into Salesforce's performance, including comments from CEO Marc Benioff, the cloud developer's positive full-year outlook, and the company's position in the AI trade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton dive deeper into Salesforce's performance, including comments from CEO Marc Benioff, the cloud developer's positive full-year outlook, and the company's position in the AI trade. headline: Stock Market Today: Indexes Mixed After Fed Warning Sends Yields Higher; Nvidia Earnings In Focus (Live Coverage)
summary: Stocks made little movement in afternoon trades Wednesday despite a key Federal Reserve report showing concerns by its board of governors over recession risks.  Investors instead appeared to anticipate earnings news from artificial intelligence titan Nvidia, due after the market close on the stock market today.  Stocks on the Dow Jones Industrial Average got turned away from their 200-day moving average, which has been a level of resistance since early April, as blue chips fell 0.3% in recent action.
